resources.string: The vision of University Programs is to be the central location for all on-campus programming. We will share our resources with other campus departments, student organizations and community partners to assist them in the planning, promotion and implementation of their events. In addition, we will engage students through programs to play a more active role in their experience and education at the Capstone.

University Programs is the student-led, student-driven board, which aims to provide University of Alabama students with a variety of events that enhance the overall student experience. We are committed to supporting the overall academic, research and service mission of The University of Alabama and the Ferguson Center Student Union by providing quality collaborative programming that promotes lifelong learning and allows all students to find a place of involvement and importance.

Home: Birmingham, AL
Major: Sports Management
Year: Graduate
Position: Graduate Assistant
 My Job: I have been with University Programs since September 2012 working as an event programmer and communications specialist. Upon receiving my Bachelor's in public relations from the University of Alabama in August 2013, I am continuing working with UP as a graduate assistant. Currently, I oversee the event programmers and provide them with advice and support. It is my goal to ensure that all programs are fully developed and implemented so we can provide the Capstone with exceptional programs year round.
Fun Fact: I went bungee jumping over spring break.

Home: Millbrook, AL
Major: Public Administration
Year: Graduate
Position: Graduate Assistant
 My Job: I co-teach the RHM Practicum course. I am responsible for the overall execution of their events as well as overseeing the marketing strategies that are put forth. This position allows me the opportunity to lead students within the University of Alabama while also learning the fundamental skills needed for my future career. I also assist in other areas within our office when needed. I consider my position to be challenging; however, I truly enjoy all of the challenges I face everyday. University Programs is a family, and I am grateful to each person that makes up our office.
Fun Fact: I have a gorgeous puppy named after a Starbuck coffee (Mocha Latte).

Home: Peoria, IL
Major: Advertising/Public Relations
Year: Graduate
Position: Graduate Assistant
 My Job: I teach the students of the APR 381 Practicum. I advise them in every aspect of the practicum course. Under my supervision, the APR 381 students work closely with the RHM 385 practicum students to gain practical work experience by planning events and implementing promotional efforts. With my guidance, students are able to explore their chosen major, while also helping them clarify and evaluate academic and career goals.
 Fun Fact: I broke both of my wrists during my senior year of high school while playing a game of dodgeball.

700 University Boulevard
Capstone Medical Building - Room 236

Tuscaloosa, AL 35487
